titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God king of England, Scotland, France and Ireland ... to all people to whome these our letters patents shall come, greeting whereas wee are credibly giuen to vnderstand aswell by ... the maior and iurats of our towne and port of Hastings, within our county of Sussex ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)

titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God king of England, Scotland, France and Ireland ... to all people to whome these our letters patents shall come, greeting whereas wee are credibly giuen to vnderstand aswell by ... the maior and iurats of our towne and port of Hastings, within our county of Sussex ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1603-1625.

notesStmt.note: For 1-year collections to repair the pier of Hastings.
Title and other title information from first 5 lines of text.
At upper left corner of sheet: Hastings, an ancient port towne in Sussex.
"Witnesse our selfe at Westminster, the sixteenth day of May, in the eighteenth yeere of our Raigne of England, France, & Ireland; and of Scotland the three and fiftieth."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
